data.title: Samuel West (actor): wife, children, height, movies, and TV shows
data.meta_description: SAMUEL WEST is an English actor, theatre director and voice actor. Check out this article to know more about his wife, children, height, movies and TV shows.
data.text:
Ever tried singing while you dance? How long did it last? Not so long. That is why every singer and actor needs a voice coach like Samuel West. Sam has worked with who’s who in the industry and ensured that when the vocals check-in, musicians and actors deliver a seamless performance.

Samuel West is one of the most recognisable names in the UK entertainment scenes. He is a film industry royalty, on top of being a famous actor, director, and voice coach. He has worked in various scenes, from TV, and radio to movies, theatre, and orchestras. But what else do you know about West?

Samuel West’s profile summary

Full name/real name: Samuel Alexander Joseph West

Nick Name: Sam West

Gender: Male

Date of birth: June 19, 1966

Age: 55 years

Zodiac sign: Gemini

Place of birth: Hammersmith, London, United Kingdom

Current residence: North London, United Kingdom

Nationality: British

Ethnicity: Caucasian

Religion: Christian

Sexuality: Straight

Height in feet: 6' 0"

Height in centimetres: 183

Hair colour: Brown

Eye colour: Brown

Siblings: 2

Marital/relationship status: In a relationship

Children: 2

School: Alleyn's School

College/University: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford

Profession: Actor/director

Net worth: approx. $10 million

Samuel West's biography

Samuel West (full name Samuel Alexander Joseph West) was born on June 16, 1966, in Hammersmith, London. He was the firstborn of Timothy West and Prunella Scales. He spent most of his childhood in London before later moving to Oxford for his college education.

West received his primary and secondary education at Alleyn's School, an independent Church of England day school in London. He then enrolled at Lady Margaret Hall, an Oxford University constituent college in Oxford. He pursued a degree in English Literature at the college and was the Experimental Theatre Club's president.

West was destined for a career in the entertainment industry. He comes from a family of actors. His mother, Prunella Scales, is an English actress famous for her role in the BBC show Fawlty Towers.

Likewise, West’s father is a film, stage, and television actor known for his role in TV series such as Coronation Street and EastEnders. Other members of Samuel west's family who are into acting include his grandfather, Lockwood West, and his siblings – Joseph and Juliana West.

Theatre

West started his acting career on the stage, making his debut in 1989. His first role was in the play Les Parents Terribles at the Orange Tree Theatre in London. He received positive feedback, marking an excellent start to a stage acting career spanning decades.

Since the first role, West has appeared in several stage roles, such as Tom Stoppard's Arcadia, where he played Valentine. He has also played titular characters in Royal Shakespeare Company's plays such as Hamlet and Richard II. Other plays he has appeared in include T.S Elliot's Family Reunion, Enron, and Uncle Vanya.

On top of acting, West has had experience with stage directing. He made his directorial debut in 2002 in the play The Lady's Not for Burning. Later, he worked as the Sheffield Theatres' artistic director, directing plays such as As You Like It and The Romans in Britain. Since then, he has directed several other plays, such as Dealer's Choice and the hit stage play, Waste.

Film and television

West has enjoyed a lucrative career in film and television acting. He made his film debut in the 1989 movie Reunion. He also appeared in the 1992 film Howards End, which saw him nominated for the 1992 BAFTA Film Awards in the best supporting actor category.

West has also appeared in several TV shows during his acting career. He was a regular feature in the hit British TV shows, Walking Dead, Midsomer Murders, and Poirot. He also appeared in the 2003 BBC show, Cambridge Spies, playing the role of Anthony Blunt.

He reprised the role in 2019 in an episode of The Crown's historical drama TV show. Other top Samuel West's movies and TV shows include:

Doctor Who (1993)

Open Fire (1994)

Carrington (1995)

Heavy Weather (1995)

Jane Eyre (1996)

The Ripper (1997)

Pandemonium (2000)

Van Helsing (2004)

Nova (2005)

Mr Selfridge (2012)

Hyde Park on Hudson (2012)

Fleming: The Man Who Would Be Bond (2014)

Darkest Hour (2017)

The Gentlemen (2019)

Death in Paradise (2020)

All Creatures Great and Small (2020)

Slow Horses (2022)

Radio and voice roles

West has held several voice roles, most prominently on radio, where he regularly appears as a reader or reciter in dramas. Some of the top drams he has played on the radio include Laura Wade’s Otherkin, Noel Coward’s Present Laughter, Harold Pinter’s The Homecoming, and others.

West also does voice narrations for documentaries. For example, he was the narrator in Yorkshire Television's The SS in Britain. He also did the voice over for the PBS show Secrets of Selfridges. Furthermore, he recited with various orchestras and took part in the 2002 performance of Last Night of the Proms.

Wife and children

Is West married? The actor is not married. However, he has been in a long-term relationship with English playwright Laura Wade. The couple met around the mid-2000s in their work and started dating. They moved in together in 2007 and have been involved ever since.

What about Samuel West's children? Does he have any? Yes, the English actor has two daughters with Laura Wade. They welcomed their first child in 2014, with the second one following three years later in 2017.

Net worth and earnings

West is a successful actor and director with decades of experience in various roles in theatre, TV, film, and radio. His primary means of income are through his acting, directing, and voice roles. He has a net worth of around $10 million.

Samuel West's fast facts

Where is Samuel West from? West is from the UK. He was born and grew up in London and currently lives in North London with his partner and children.

Did Samuel West and Laura Wade Split? West and Laura Wade are still in a relationship. However, the couple split in 2011 before getting back together in 2013.

Who is Samuel West's mother? West’s mother is Prunella Margaret Rumney West Scales, an actress with an acting career spanning over 60 years. Unfortunately, she quit acting after suffering from deteriorating health due to Alzheimer’s disease.

Who is Samuel West’s brother? West has a younger brother, Joseph. He is also an actor and has appeared in several roles alongside him (Samuel) and their parents.

Does Samuel West have a sister? West has a half-sister, Juliet West, who is also an actress. She is Timothy West’s daughter from his first marriage to actress Jacqueline Boyer.

What is Samuel West’s height? West is pretty tall. He stands at the height of six feet (1.83 metres).

What is Samuel West’s net worth? West is a successful actor and director with a career spanning several decades. His net worth is around $10 million.

Samuel West was destined for the acting industry, with his parents and grandparents having been successful actors. From a young age, he took an interest in the industry and pursued a course that would set him on a path to being the successful actor and director he is today.

Tuko.co.ke shared an interesting article about Brendan Gleeson's height, net worth, wife, family, movies, and TV shows. He is a Dublin-born actor and film director. Although he has acted in many high-budget TV shows and movies, he is best known for Harry Potter films such as Alastor Moody.

Brendan Gleeson is a family man. He has been married for close to 40 years. His perfect balance, between his acting career and family, makes him one of the most admired professionals in the film industry.

Source: TUKO.co.ke
